content.text: I'll help you update the existing time_card_entry schema to add lunch break tracking fields. Let me start by reading the current schema structure.

content.content:
============================================================
Name: time_card_entry
ORM: src/sdk/database/orm/orm_time_card_entry.ts
Description: Records a specific work shift entry with clock-in and clock-out times.

Fields (12):
  - id: string
    Unique identifier for the time card entry (UUID).
  - data_creator: string
    id of the user who creates the record
  - data_updater: string
    id of the user who updates the record
  - create_time: string [format: timestamp]
    create time in timestamp unix
  - update_time: string [format: timestamp]
    update time in timestamp unix
  - user_id: string
    ID of the user this time card belongs to.
  - clock_in_timestamp: string [format: timestamp]
    Timestamp when the shift started.
  - clock_out_timestamp: string (nullable) [format: timestamp]
    Timestamp when the shift ended. Null implies an active shift.
  - total_hours: number (nullable)
    Calculated duration of the shift in hours.
  - notes: string (nullable)
    Optional text notes regarding the shift.
  - location: string (nullable)
    Where the employee worked that day.
  - work_description: string (nullable)
    What work the employee did that day.

Indexes (8):
  [1] id (primary, unique)
  [2] data_creator
  [3] data_updater
  [4] user_id
  [5] clock_in_timestamp (ordered)
  [6] clock_in_timestamp, user_id (ordered)
  [7] clock_out_timestamp
  [8] location


============================================================
Name: user
ORM: src/sdk/database/orm/orm_user.ts
Description: Represents a user in the system, either an Employee or a Manager.

Fields (8):
  - id: string
    Unique identifier for the user (UUID).
  - data_creator: string
    id of the user who creates the record
  - data_updater: string
    id of the user who updates the record
  - create_time: string [format: timestamp]
    create time in timestamp unix
  - update_time: string [format: timestamp]
    update time in timestamp unix
  - name: string
    Full name of the user.
  - email: string [format: email]
    Email address of the user.
  - role: enumeration
    Role of the user in the system.

Indexes (4):
  [1] id (primary, unique)
  [2] data_creator
  [3] data_updater
  [4] email (unique)

content.content:
============================================================
Name: time_card_entry
ORM: src/sdk/database/orm/orm_time_card_entry.ts
Description: Records a specific work shift entry with clock-in and clock-out times, including lunch break tracking.

Fields (15):
  - id: string
    Unique identifier for the time card entry (UUID).
  - data_creator: string
    id of the user who creates the record
  - data_updater: string
    id of the user who updates the record
  - create_time: string [format: timestamp]
    create time in timestamp unix
  - update_time: string [format: timestamp]
    update time in timestamp unix
  - user_id: string
    ID of the user this time card belongs to.
  - clock_in_timestamp: string [format: timestamp]
    Timestamp when the shift started.
  - clock_out_timestamp: string (nullable) [format: timestamp]
    Timestamp when the shift ended. Null implies an active shift.
  - total_hours: number (nullable)
    Calculated duration of the shift in hours.
  - notes: string (nullable)
    Optional text notes regarding the shift.
  - location: string (nullable)
    Where the employee worked that day.
  - work_description: string (nullable)
    What work the employee did that day.
  - lunch_start_timestamp: string (nullable) [format: timestamp]
    Timestamp when employee started lunch break.
  - lunch_end_timestamp: string (nullable) [format: timestamp]
    Timestamp when employee ended lunch break.
  - lunch_duration_minutes: number (nullable)
    Total lunch break duration in minutes.

Indexes (8):
  [1] id (primary, unique)
  [2] data_creator
  [3] data_updater
  [4] user_id
  [5] clock_in_timestamp (ordered)
  [6] clock_in_timestamp, user_id (ordered)

content.text:
Perfect! The ORM files have been successfully generated. The schema update is complete.

## Summary

The time_card_entry schema has been successfully updated with the three lunch break tracking fields:

**Updated Fields Added:**
1. **lunch_start_timestamp** (string, optional) - Timestamp when employee started lunch break
2. **lunch_end_timestamp** (string, optional) - Timestamp when employee ended lunch break
3. **lunch_duration_minutes** (number, optional) - Total lunch break duration in minutes

**Generated ORM Files:**
- `/home/user/vite-template/src/sdk/database/orm/orm_time_card_entry.ts` - Updated with new fields
- `/home/user/vite-template/src/sdk/database/orm/common.ts` - Common types and utilities
- `/home/user/vite-template/src/sdk/database/orm/client.ts` - Database client
- `/home/user/vite-template/src/sdk/database/orm/orm_user.ts` - User ORM

The time_card_entry table now contains 15 fields total (12 original fields + 3 new lunch break fields), with all lunch-related fields marked as optional (nullable) to support both entries with and without lunch break data.
